intro: Streptocarpus solenanthus, commonly known as the Cape bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb with upright stems and broad, ovate leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial shade, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period and unique floral structure.
